#Text=Sfântu Gheorghe ( Covasna )

#Text=Sfântu Gheorghe ( in Romanian ) or Sepsiszentgyörgy ( in Hungarian ) ( English : Saint George ; Deutsch : Sankt Georgen ; Yiddish : סנט דשזארדזש ) is a municipality and city in the central Romania n region of Transylvania .
#Text=It lies on the Olt River in a valley between the Baraolt and Bodoc Mountains .
#Text=Sfântu Gheorghe is the capital of Covasna County .
#Text=The villages of Chilieni/Kilyén and Coşeni/Szotyor are also administratively part of Sfântu Gheorghe Municipality .
#Text=Get in
#Text=Sfântu Gheorghe lies about 220 km from Bucuresti , 1,790 km from Berlin , 990 km from Wien , 780 km from Budapest , 280 km from Cluj Napoca , 32 km from Brasov , and 66 km from Miercurea Ciuc .
#Text=By train
#Text=You can get to Sfantu Gheorghe by train very easily .
#Text=There are direct trains to and from Bucharest , the capital of Romania , as well as Brasov , Cluj-Napoca , Baia Mare , Satu Mare , Miercurea Ciuc , Targu Mures , Iasi , and Suceava .
#Text=With IC ( InterCity ) : Bucharest - Ploiesti - Sinaia - Brasov - Sfantu Gheorghe - Miercurea Ciuc - Deda - Targu Mures .
#Text=With Rapid ( fast train as IC ) : Brasov - Sfantu Gheorghe - Miercurea Ciuc - Deda - Cluj Napoca .

#Text=With Accelerat ( less comfortable than IC , but almost the same time as IC ) : Bucharest - Ploiesti - Brasov - Sfantu Gheorghe - Miercurea Ciuc - Deda - Baia Mare - Satu Mare ; Brasov - Sfantu Gheorghe - Iasi ; Brasov - Sfantu Gheorghe - Suceava
#Text=There are two international trains stopping in the city , both providing a direct link with Budapest , Hungary .
#Text=By car
#Text=From Brasov - on national road DN 11 , then take left in Chichis ( Kokos ) to DN 12 .
#Text=From Targu-Mures ( Marosvásárhely ) - on national road DN 13 , take a left at Feldioara ( Barcaföldvár ) to DN 13E .
#Text=From Miercurea Ciuc - on national road DN 12 .
#Text=By plane
#Text=Wizz Air operates international flights to several countries from Transylvania Airport at Targu-Mures , a good two and half hours drive from the town .
#Text=Bucharest Henri Coanda Airport is also about the same distance from the city , serving many international flights operated by regular and low-cost airlines .
#Text=Sibiu airport is also at the same distance .
#Text=By bus
#Text=Even if the town is quite small , a ride with the bus will take you quick from one point to another .
#Text=The ticket for one journey is 1.30 lei , but usually , you may buy a 2-journey ticket for 2.60 lei .

#Text=There are several lines that will take you through the town : number 1 - Simeria - Central Park - Rail Station ; number 2 - Simeria - Central Park - Ciucului - Rail Station ; number 3 - Central Market - Central Park - Rail Station and other buses will take you in the villages round the town :
#Text=number 4 - Simeria - Central Park - Ciucului - Rail Station - Campu Frumos
#Text=By taxi
#Text=If you want to take the taxi , it will take you in a short time - about 5-10 minutes - anywhere in town you like .
#Text=If you want , you can take the taxi outside the town , but it is more expensive .
#Text=There are many taxi hubs , in the city center there is one directly across the theater , another one in front of Sugas department store .
#Text=By car
#Text=Due to the size of the city , it does n't make much sense to use a car .
#Text=Parking in the center can be problematic and relative expensive ( 2 lei/hr ) .
#Text=Traffic is not bad , except a few minutes in the morning and afternoon in certain places , mostly around schools .
#Text=Just walk or if you are in hurry or have to travel from one end to the other , use a taxi .
#Text=There are a few local car rental offices , but there are no multinational , big rental companies in the city .
#Text=See at Novotech , Mida ( pages only in Romanian ) .
#Text=See
#Text=The area has almost 40 species of endemic orchids that can be seen .
#Text=If you wish to see them , contact the Romanian Orchid Lovers Club , based in Rasnov 20 km from Brasov .
#Text=Székely National Museum .
#Text=Hosting an exhibition of about the traditions and arts of the local Hungarian population .
#Text=The building was designed by Károly Kós in the secession style .
#Text=Fortified Church ( Romanian : Biserică Fortificată ; Hungarian : Vártemplom ) .
#Text=Constructed in the 14th century in the Gothic style
#Text=The market bazaar .
#Text=Built in 1868 , with a clock tower built in 1893 , now home to the gallery Magma and a café .
#Text=County library .
#Text=Constructed in 1832 as the seat of the county council .
#Text=State Archive .
#Text=The former headquarters of the Hussar battalions .
#Text=Theater Áron Tamási .
#Text=Used from 1854-1866 as the city hall .
#Text=Do
#Text=Going out in town , you will find pubs with good music and nice atmosphere .
#Text=A nice walk in the central park will be very relaxing .
#Text=You can visit the surrounding villages and take a look at the fortified churches typical of the area .
#Text=Sugas Bai ( Sugásfürdő in Hungarian ) .
#Text=A holiday mountain-village part of the city offering two ski slopes , warm and cold baths , mofetta , climbing wall , adventure park , hiking trails and natural sparkling water springs .
#Text=It is reachable by car , bus , bike ( 10 km from the center , uphill ) .
#Text=Buy
#Text=There are several hypermarkets and supermarkets along the Olt river bench ( Str .
#Text=Lunca Oltului / Oltmező utca ) where you can buy food , clothing , electronics , tinkering stuff , etc. , but they are not served by local buses .
#Text=Sugas ( Sugas Comercial Center ) ( right in town center ) .
#Text=Here you can get a lot of things from souvenirs , clothes , shoes .
#Text=Eat
#Text=Kurtos
#Text=kalacs are a type of Hungarian sweet pastry .
#Text=There are is also good ice cream in the Aria sweet shop and patiseria ( close to the Sugás shopping center ) .
#Text=Some other good sweet shops are around the central park .
#Text=Drink
#Text=Palinca or Palinka is the best known alcoholic beverage in town like in all Transylvania .
#Text=Beer is also one of the favorite drink in the town .
#Text=There is a tea house ( Tein ) near the central park , and several pubs around the city , some with parties at weekends .
#Text=Sleep
#Text=Pensiunea Agora ( Pensiunea Agora ) , Crangului , Nr . 1 ( near the central market ) , ☏ +40367401912 .
#Text=Offers two rooms with one bed , shower and TV , two rooms with two beds shower and TV , two rooms with four beds , one room with two beds .
#Text=There is a men and women bathroom and WC , refrigerator , mini-kitchen , central heating and wifi access .
#Text=50lei/day .
#Text=Pensiunea Malomgat ( Pensiunea Malomgat ) , Malomgat 5 , ☏ +40741177515 .
#Text=Guest house has 4 rooms and 2 bathrooms , living with kitchen , central heating , garden .
#Text=Pensiunea Andreas ( Pensiunea Andreas ) , Varghis , Str . Principala , Nr . 59 , ☏ +40722760016 .
#Text=Guest house has 5 rooms with bathrooms , 7 with common bath , TV , billiards , ping-pong table , swimming pool , ATV , arbor , grill , parking space .
#Text=Pensiunea Anna ( Pensiunea Anna ) , Bixad , Str . Ciucului Nr . 556 , Jud. Covasna .
#Text=Guest house offers you 4 rooms at 3 baths , kitchen , parking space , central heating .
#Text=Motel Tranzit ( Motel Tranzit ) , Pais David , Nr . 2/A , ☏ +40745692745 .
#Text=It is in the same building with the Lukoil Gas station .
#Text=Restaurant
#Text=Non-Stop ( 70 seats )
#Text=Parking space
#Text=Hotel Sugas ( Hotel Sugas ) , Sfantu Gheorghe Km 0 , Covasna , ☏ +40267312171 , +40 267 311 787 .
#Text=Placed in the center of Sfantu Gheorghe town , Sugas offers you 27 double rooms , 4 apartments , minibar , tv cable , phone , internet , restaurant .
#Text=Single 165 lei , double 179 lei , triple 210 lei .
#Text=Apartments for 1/2/3/4 persons 220/240/260/280 lei .
#Text=Hotel Park ( Hotel Park ) , Sfantu Gheorghe , Gabor Aron , Nr . 12 ( just above the central park in the town ) , ☏ +40267311058 .
#Text=Pensiunea Trei Scaune ( Pensiunea Trei Scaune ) , Sfantu Gheorghe , Str .
#Text=Kossuth Lajos , 17 , ☏ +40728985366 .
#Text=10 rooms with baths , kitchen , livingroom , courtyard .
